title: Drawing, "Design for a Looking Glass and Console Table", 1810–30
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and  violet, olive, yellow water colors; graphite on off white laid paper.
markings: Verso: stamp: Museum of the Arts of Decoration [Lugt 457d]
inscribed: Below is the scale: "Palmi Romani," struck out with pencil; the height of the table is given at right as: "p 4/6." Verso: Horizontally pencil plans with measurements; written: "La luce d;"
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Intended to be executed in wood with ornaments of gilded metal. Below is a console table with four legs and a backboard. The oblong glass is framed outside by two columns, in a pseudo-Egyptian style as are the legs. Above is a mask with rinceaux and winged lions in front of the panel.  At the left edge is a part of a pencil plan. Reverse: vertically a childish profile.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Looking Glass and Console Table", 1810–30.
1810–30. Pen and black ink; brush and  violet, olive, yellow water colors; graphite on off white laid paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-586.
